TITLE: Correctional officer shot outside jail in Atlanta suburb
SUMMARY: Police say a correctional officer has been shot and killed outside a jail in an Atlanta suburb

TITLE: A slowdown in US inflation eases some pressure on households
SUMMARY: Inflation in the United States slowed again last month in the latest sign that price increases are cooling despite the pressures they continue to inflict on American households

TITLE: Bald eagle found shot in Wisconsin dies during surgery
SUMMARY: A bald eagle shot in Wisconsin has died during surgery to treat its injuries

TITLE: Woman, boyfriend arrested after toddlers injured, later die
SUMMARY: A West Virginia woman and her boyfriend have been charged after two toddlers were hospitalized and later died

TITLE: Military ID's WWII Army Air Force soldier from New Jersey
SUMMARY: Defense Department officials say the remains of an Army Air Force sergeant from New Jersey who died during World War II have been positively identified

TITLE: 8 hurt in fire at NYPD warehouse where evidence is stored
SUMMARY: Officials say eight people have suffered minor injuries in a fire at a New York Police Department facilty that houses DNA evidence from crime scenes as well as cars, e-bikes and motor scooters

TITLE: US prosecutors: FTX founder Bankman-Fried made illegal campaign donations totaling in the 'tens of millions of dollars'
SUMMARY: US prosecutors: FTX founder Bankman-Fried made illegal campaign donations totaling in the 'tens of millions of dollars'

TITLE: Editorial Roundup: United States
SUMMARY: Excerpts from recent editorials in the United States and abroad:

TITLE: Scientists declare on same day Hawaii's Kilauea and Mauna Loa volcanoes are no longer erupting
SUMMARY: Scientists declare on same day Hawaii's Kilauea and Mauna Loa volcanoes are no longer erupting

TITLE: Inflation is slowing, but still high. What you need to know
SUMMARY: After reaching 40-year highs over the summer, price increases in the U.S. are now steadily easing

TITLE: Police: Customer shoots St. Louis KFC employee over no corn
SUMMARY: St. Louis police say a KFC employee in St. Louis was hospitalized after a customer shot him because he was upset that the restaurant had run out of corn

TITLE: Witness who helped convict man: Testimony still 'haunts' him
SUMMARY: A witness whose testimony helped send a man to prison for a killing decades ago has testified his role in the case of Lamar Johnson “still haunts" him

TITLE: Judge rules against Oklahoma in attempt to execute inmate
SUMMARY: A federal judge in Texas has rejected Oklahoma's attempt to have a federal prisoner transferred to state custody so he can be executed

TITLE: Scientists declare 2 Hawaii volcanoes have stopped erupting
SUMMARY: Scientists have declared on the same day that two active Hawaii volcanoes have stopped erupting

TITLE: Judge: Texas death row inmate should get new, unbiased trial
SUMMARY: A court ruling says a Jewish death row inmate who was part of the “Texas 7” should have his conviction overturned and get a new trial because the judge presiding over his case “harbored antisemitic bias.”

TITLE: Men and dog missing for 10 days found on powerless sailboat
SUMMARY: The U.S. Coast Guard says two men and a pet dog have been rescued from a sailboat more than 200 miles off Delaware's coast and 10 days after friends and family last heard from them

TITLE: Remains of Confederate general removed from under monument
SUMMARY: The remains of a Confederate general have been unearthed in Richmond a day after a statue bearing his name was taken down

TITLE: Massachusetts governor seeks pardons in 1980s sex abuse case
SUMMARY: A Massachusetts Statehouse panel is weighing whether to approve Gov. Charlie Baker’s recommended pardons of two individuals at the center of one the nation’s most high-profile sexual abuse trials of the 1980s

TITLE: Suspected Russian FSB officer charged in U.S. sanctions case
SUMMARY: A suspected officer with Russia’s Federal Security Service was among seven people accused by federal prosecutors with helping the country illegally obtain sensitive electronic components from U.S. companies to help Russia’s military efforts

TITLE: Florida Senate passes property insurance overhaul
SUMMARY: The Florida Senate has approved sweeping legislation that would overhaul the state’s property insurance system, which has struggled due to insolvencies, high costs and major storms

TITLE: Florida jury finds Hugo Chavez's ex-nurse guilty of money laundering in closely-watched Venezuela corruption case
SUMMARY: Florida jury finds Hugo Chavez's ex-nurse guilty of money laundering in closely-watched Venezuela corruption case

TITLE: SD prosecutors drop all charges against Indigenous activist
SUMMARY: South Dakota prosecutors have dropped all charges against the head of an Indigenous-led advocacy organization stemming from a protest during then-President Donald Trump’s visit to Mount Rushmore

TITLE: Army sergeant killed at Georgia base was an Afghan veteran
SUMMARY: The Army has identified a soldier who was fatally shot at a Georgia base as a sergeant whose nearly eight years of military service included a deployment to Afghanistan

TITLE: Explosives, drug lab ruled out in deadly Texas explosion
SUMMARY: Authorities say they have ruled out a drug lab and explosive devices as the cause of last week’s deadly explosion at an underground residence and construction business in Texas

TITLE: 3 WVa reporters who condemned interview of ex-coal CEO fired
SUMMARY: Three newspaper reporters in West Virginia say they have been fired after publicly criticizing their company's video interview with a convicted former coal executive
